column5: I have an old Shakespeare dumb ass-1 Scanmaster that works and was wondering if it would be any good for ice fishing  anybody had any experience with them.  Thanks crabbs
Sorry I can't help you with the flasher question Bud but welcome aboard and if I were you, I'd PM either TJ or Roy as soon as possible.
Have you and TJ caught the crabbs again???
as long as it's working and you learn to read it it will do fine it's not as good as the newer ones but it sure beats not having a unit

Don't listen to all the crap about which unit is best, any flasher will give you all the info you need , I use an still do an old vex fl8 and it gives me all the info I need when ice fishing, I sorta laugh out loud when I see these dudes arguing over vex... marcum.and such all you need is a flasher to mark your presention  and your 90% better then fishing blind. Just get a unit that will pick up your presentation and your good to go
Do any of you older lads remember or heard of the old Heathkit flasher?....

I remember that one you had it build it form a kit , thats about the same time I bought a green box remeber those old ones, good ole flashers would be perfect for ice fishers hahahaha, lowerence made the green box I think
The green boxes were the original and were indeed made by Lowrance.
I used to have a mother-in-law that was known as 'the old campground flasher'.  We had lots of trouble with her.
Awesome......I think I tried the heathkit flasher back in 1981
there she is the old beauty  well we will see how she goes on the whities out on Crystal Lake

The only thing that it might do is cause interference to other flashers in the area, most new flashers have interference rejection systems but might not get rid of interference from older models. Or other flashers from around you might interfere with yours.
